page.title: 01The outline to the square.
page.content: The area covered by the survey is gently rolling countryside sloping down to the valley of the river Great Ouse in the west. It is predominantly agriculture-with large open arable fields and few hedgerows but there are some smaller pasture fields used for grazing livestock. There are two centres of population the eastern edge of the large village of Sharnbrook and the smaller village of Bletsoe. Both of these may be described as dormitory villages with most of the working population travelling to Bedford.Colworth House(Unilever Research)or London.The latter is made possible by the newly electrified raillink between Bedford and London and the nearness to the M.1.
